name: Pop-Free CB 2 Quiz / Test | Common Bond 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: The ________ of a horse has 4 chambers.
questions.explanation:
Heart.

	All mammals have 4-chambered hearts. Ruminants, like cows and goats, have 4-chambered stomachs, but a horse is not a ruminant.

questions.text: Do metals expand or contract when they become colder?
questions.explanation:
Contract.

	Most solids expand when heated and contract when cooled. Water is a notable exception- ice expands.

questions.text: In most Native American tales, any god who is associated with Coyote is most likely to ___________ people.
questions.explanation:
Trick.

	Coyote is usually known as the Trickster God. Like the fox in Aesop's fables, he often falls afoul of his own wit.

questions.text: What is the hardest material on the Mohs scale of mineral hardness?
questions.explanation:
Diamond.

	The softest is talc, which can be scratched with a fingernail.

questions.text: Which of the following was invented in China, picked up by Islamic cultures, and imported into Europe by 1377?
questions.explanation:
Cards.

	Playing cards were invented in China, the home of paper. They went through many revisions before they resembled the cards we know today.

questions.text: In the United States, keys which are not allowed to be copied are stamped with "Do Not ___________."
questions.explanation:
Duplicate.

	These are usually business or office keys.

questions.text: In what part of your body would you find metacarpals and phalanges?
questions.explanation:
Hands.

	Both are bones of the fingers.

questions.text: What is the last name of the famous detective character created by Dashiell Hammett?
questions.explanation:
Spade.

	The detective's full name is Sam Spade. His most well-known novel is "The Maltese Falcon." Travis McGee was created by John D. MacDonald, Hercule Poirot by Agatha Christie, and Nero Wolfe by Rex Stout.

questions.text: Which of the following is generally considered to be the first weapon manufactured by primitive man?
questions.explanation:
Club.

	The first clubs were wooden, of course. Primitive axes were used as cutting tools, not weapons.

questions.text: All right...what do all of the answers to these questions have in common?
questions.explanation:
Bridge & duplicate bridge & contract bridge.

	Spades, hearts, diamonds and clubs are suits of cards, of course. Duplicate and contract are forms of bridge. Bridge is played with cards. In each round of bridge, there are four hands, and the object is to take tricks.
